title: 100+ Dry & Sarcastic Jokes for Anyone with a Deadpan Sense of Humor

steps.title: What’s the one thing in life you can actually always count on?
steps.content: What’s the one thing in life you can actually always count on? A calculator.

steps.title: Why did the dinosaur cross the road?
steps.content: Why did the dinosaur cross the road? Chickens hadn’t evolved yet.

steps.title: What is the leading cause of dry skin?
steps.content: What is the leading cause of dry skin? Towels.

steps.title: Why should you never eat a clock?
steps.content: Why should you never eat a clock? It’s too time-consuming.

steps.title: Don’t you hate it when someone answers their own questions?
steps.content: Don’t you hate it when someone answers their own questions? I do.

steps.title: A cow with a twitch is called what?
steps.content: A cow with a twitch is called what? Beef jerky.

steps.title: Do you want to know what always makes me smile?
steps.content: Do you want to know what always makes me smile? Face muscles.

steps.title: Why did the old man fall into the well?
steps.content: Why did the old man fall into the well? Because he couldn’t see that well.

steps.title: What do you call a fish with no eyes?
steps.content: What do you call a fish with no eyes? A fsh.

steps.title: Can you tell me what’s red and smells like blue paint?
steps.content: Can you tell me what’s red and smells like blue paint? Red paint.

steps.title: What did the drummer name her twin daughters?
steps.content: What did the drummer name her twin daughters? Anna One, Anna Two.

steps.title: I have the world's worst thesaurus.
steps.content: I have the world's worst thesaurus. Not only is it terrible, it's also terrible.

steps.title: I threw away my can opener.
steps.content: I threw away my can opener. It was more of a can’t opener.

steps.title: Most people are shocked when they find out how bad I am as an electrician.
steps.content: Most people are shocked when they find out how bad I am as an electrician.

steps.title: People who use selfie sticks really need to have a good, long look at themselves.
steps.content: People who use selfie sticks really need to have a good, long look at themselves.

steps.title: I asked what I should bring to the party.
steps.content: I asked what I should bring to the party. The hosts said, “Nothing, just bring a happy face.” I had to cancel.

steps.title: You know you’re a true 90s kid… When you look at your birth certificate and it says that you were born between 1990 and 1999.
steps.content: You know you’re a true 90s kid… When you look at your birth certificate and it says that you were born between 1990 and 1999.

steps.title: Imagine if you walked into a bar and there was a long line of people waiting to hit you.
steps.content: Imagine if you walked into a bar and there was a long line of people waiting to hit you. That’s the punchline.

steps.title: My dog is an awesome fashion adviser.
steps.content: My dog is an awesome fashion adviser. Every time I ask him what I look like in my clothes, he says, "WOW!"

steps.title: I broke my finger last week.
steps.content: I broke my finger last week. On the other hand, I’m okay.

steps.title: "I work with animals," the guy says to his Tinder date.
steps.content: "I work with animals," the guy says to his Tinder date. "That's so sweet," she replies. "I like a man who loves animals. Where do you work?" "I'm a butcher," he says.

steps.title: A man limps to the doctor’s office and gasps, "Doctor, I was bitten by my dog."
steps.content: A man limps to the doctor’s office and gasps, "Doctor, I was bitten by my dog." The doctor checks, "Did you put anything on it?" "No, he seemed to be enjoying the taste without any condiments."

steps.title: A horse walks into a bar, and the bartender asks, "Why the long face?
steps.content: A horse walks into a bar, and the bartender asks, "Why the long face? "The horse says, "Evolution."

steps.title: Two windmills are standing on a wind farm.
steps.content: Two windmills are standing on a wind farm. [1] X Research source One asks, "What’s your favorite type of music?" The other says, "I’m a big metal fan." [2] X Research source

steps.title: 5/4 of people admit that they’re bad with fractions.
steps.content: 5/4 of people admit that they’re bad with fractions. [3] X Research source

steps.title: At a restaurant, I asked the waiter how they prepare their chicken.
steps.content: At a restaurant, I asked the waiter how they prepare their chicken. "Nothing special," he explained. "We just tell them they’re going to die."

steps.title: A patient told the surgeon he couldn’t feel his legs.
steps.content: A patient told the surgeon he couldn’t feel his legs. The surgeon replied, "I know. I amputated your arms."

steps.title: A jumper cable walks into a bar.
steps.content: A jumper cable walks into a bar. The bartender says, "I'll serve you, but don't start anything."

steps.title: You know why they called it "the dark ages?"
steps.content: You know why they called it "the dark ages?" There were too many knights.

steps.title: I was drinking a martini, and the waitress screamed
steps.content: I was drinking a martini, and the waitress screamed "Does anyone know CPR?" I yelled, "I know the entire alphabet," and we all laughed and laughed. Well, except one person.

steps.title: Me: I’d like to travel.
steps.content: Me: I’d like to travel. My bank account: To work?

steps.title: I asked the Gym instructor, "Can you teach me to do the splits?"
steps.content: I asked the Gym instructor, "Can you teach me to do the splits?" He said, "How flexible are you?" I said, "I can’t make Tuesdays."

steps.title: RIP Boiling Water. You will be mist.
steps.content: RIP Boiling Water. You will be mist.

steps.title: Knock knock!
steps.content: Knock knock! Who’s there? Interrupting cow. Interrupting c– MOO!

steps.title: What’s the quickest way to get to the hospital?Just stand in the middle of a busy road!
steps.content: What’s the quickest way to get to the hospital?Just stand in the middle of a busy road! [4] X Research source

steps.title: Teacher says to the children, "Every minute I stand here talking to you, 12 people die."
steps.content: Teacher says to the children, "Every minute I stand here talking to you, 12 people die." Little Johnny raises his hand. "Perhaps you could try some mouthwash?"

steps.title: Three fish are in a tank.
steps.content: Three fish are in a tank. One asked the others, "How the heck do you drive this thing?"

steps.title: Cashier:
steps.content: Cashier: "Would you like the milk in a bag, sir?" Me: "No, just leave it in the carton!"

steps.title: Two cannibals are eating a clown.
steps.content: Two cannibals are eating a clown. One asks the other, "Does this taste funny to you?"

steps.title: My therapist says I have a preoccupation with vengeance.
steps.content: My therapist says I have a preoccupation with vengeance. We’ll see about that.

steps.title: What does an organ donor do when he dies?
steps.content: What does an organ donor do when he dies? He mingles in the crowd.

steps.title: What’s the best part about living in Switzerland?
steps.content: What’s the best part about living in Switzerland? I don’t know, but the flag is a big plus.

steps.title: What is written on a dentist’s grave?
steps.content: What is written on a dentist’s grave? He’s filling his last cavity.

steps.title: What is red and extremely bad for your teeth?
steps.content: What is red and extremely bad for your teeth? A flying brick.

steps.title: Where was the Constitution signed?
steps.content: Where was the Constitution signed? At the bottom.

steps.title: How do you get someone to stop swinging on the tire swing?
steps.content: How do you get someone to stop swinging on the tire swing? Snip the rope.

steps.title: What do you call a pencil sharpener that can’t sharpen pencils?
steps.content: What do you call a pencil sharpener that can’t sharpen pencils? Broken.

steps.title: Scientific fact!
steps.content: Scientific fact! If you took all the veins from your body and laid them end to end, you would die.

steps.title: Did you hear about the fire in the shoe factory?
steps.content: Did you hear about the fire in the shoe factory? 10,000 soles were lost.

steps.title: How do you make holy water?
steps.content: How do you make holy water? You boil the hell out of it.

steps.title: What’s white and annoying at breakfast?
steps.content: What’s white and annoying at breakfast? An avalanche.

steps.title: You don’t need a parachute to go skydiving.
steps.content: You don’t need a parachute to go skydiving. You need a parachute to go skydiving twice. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Don’t challenge Death to a pillow fight.
steps.content: Don’t challenge Death to a pillow fight. ...Unless you’re prepared for the reaper cushions.

steps.title: My grandma has the heart of a lion and a lifetime ban from the zoo.
steps.content: My grandma has the heart of a lion and a lifetime ban from the zoo.

steps.title: I’m reading a book about anti-gravity.
steps.content: I’m reading a book about anti-gravity. It’s impossible to put down.

steps.title: Parallel lines have so much in common.
steps.content: Parallel lines have so much in common. It’s a shame they’ll never meet.

steps.title: I have a stepladder because my real ladder left when I was 5.
steps.content: I have a stepladder because my real ladder left when I was 5.

steps.title: The most corrupt CEOs are the ones who run pretzel companies.
steps.content: The most corrupt CEOs are the ones who run pretzel companies. They’re always so twisted.

steps.title: Roses are dead, violets are dead.
steps.content: Roses are dead, violets are dead. I am a bad gardener.

steps.title: I don’t have a carbon footprint.
steps.content: I don’t have a carbon footprint. I just drive everywhere.

steps.title: Two guys walk into a bar.
steps.content: Two guys walk into a bar. The third guy ducks.

steps.title: Have you heard about the butter rumor?
steps.content: Have you heard about the butter rumor? Never mind, I shouldn’t be spreading it.

steps.title: What did one Frenchman say to the other Frenchman?
steps.content: What did one Frenchman say to the other Frenchman? How on Earth would I know? I don’t speak French.

steps.title: What do you call 100 lawyers at the bottom of the ocean?
steps.content: What do you call 100 lawyers at the bottom of the ocean? A horrible boating accident.

steps.title: Why do flamingos stand on one leg?
steps.content: Why do flamingos stand on one leg? If they tried lifting the other one, they’d fall over.

steps.title: Why did Mozart hate chickens?
steps.content: Why did Mozart hate chickens? When he asked them who the best composer was, they all replied, "Bach, Bach, Bach."

steps.title: What do you call a dog with no legs?
steps.content: What do you call a dog with no legs? Doesn’t matter what you call him, he won’t come anyway.

steps.title: Why are elevator jokes so classic?
steps.content: Why are elevator jokes so classic? They work on many levels.

steps.title: What is Forrest Gump’s password?
steps.content: What is Forrest Gump’s password? 1forest1

steps.title: What is brown and sticky?
steps.content: What is brown and sticky? A stick.

steps.title: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
steps.content: An apple a day keeps the doctor away. Or at least it does if you throw it hard enough.

steps.title: There are three types of people in the world:
steps.content: There are three types of people in the world: Those who can count and those who can’t.

steps.title: A flat earther’s only fear…is sphere itself.
steps.content: A flat earther’s only fear…is sphere itself.

steps.title: I told my friend she was drawing her eyebrows too high.
steps.content: I told my friend she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised.

steps.title: I was shocked when I found out my toaster wasn’t waterproof.
steps.content: I was shocked when I found out my toaster wasn’t waterproof.

steps.title: Why do chicken coops only have two doors?
steps.content: Why do chicken coops only have two doors? Because if they had four, they’d be chicken sedans.

steps.title: I'm going to try on my new reversible jacket after work today.
steps.content: I'm going to try on my new reversible jacket after work today. I can't wait to see how it turns out.

steps.title: I ordered a chicken and an egg from Amazon.
steps.content: I ordered a chicken and an egg from Amazon. I'll let you know.

steps.title: I sold my vacuum the other day.
steps.content: I sold my vacuum the other day. All it was doing was collecting dust.

steps.title: I can't stand kleptomaniacs.
steps.content: I can't stand kleptomaniacs. They take things literally.

steps.title: My boss told me to have a good day.
steps.content: My boss told me to have a good day. So I went home.

steps.title: What did the fish say when he swam into the wall?
steps.content: What did the fish say when he swam into the wall? Dam.

steps.title: How do I eat consciously?
steps.content: How do I eat consciously? You try not to lose consciousness when eating.

steps.title: What does a baby computer call its father?
steps.content: What does a baby computer call its father? Data.

steps.title: What do you do if your eyes are dry?
steps.content: What do you do if your eyes are dry? Moisturize.

steps.title: What has two wings but can't fly, two legs but can't walk, and two eyes but can't see?
steps.content: What has two wings but can't fly, two legs but can't walk, and two eyes but can't see? A dead bird.

steps.title: Why did the man miss the funeral?
steps.content: Why did the man miss the funeral? He wasn’t a mourning person.

steps.title: What did one stranger say to the other?
steps.content: What did one stranger say to the other? Nothing. They didn’t know each other.

steps.title: Why are there fences around cemeteries?
steps.content: Why are there fences around cemeteries? Everyone’s always dying to get in.

steps.title: Did you know the first French fries weren’t cooked in France?
steps.content: Did you know the first French fries weren’t cooked in France? They were cooked in Greece!

steps.title: If you see a crime at an Apple store, are you an iWitness?
steps.content: If you see a crime at an Apple store, are you an iWitness?

steps.title: What do you get when you combine a rhetorical question and a joke?
steps.content: What do you get when you combine a rhetorical question and a joke?

steps.title: Did you hear the story about the claustrophobic astronaut?
steps.content: Did you hear the story about the claustrophobic astronaut? He just needed some space.

steps.title: Give a man a match, and he’ll be warm for a few hours.
steps.content: Give a man a match, and he’ll be warm for a few hours. Set him on fire, and he will be warm for the rest of his life.

steps.title: Did you hear about the beautiful wedding?
steps.content: Did you hear about the beautiful wedding? Even the cake was in tiers.

steps.title: A dyslexic man walks into a bra.
steps.content: A dyslexic man walks into a bra.

steps.title: My wife is mad that I have no sense of direction.
steps.content: My wife is mad that I have no sense of direction. So I packed up my stuff and right.

steps.title: Why do dads take an extra pair of socks when they go golfing?
steps.content: Why do dads take an extra pair of socks when they go golfing? In case they get a hole-in-one.

steps.title: I used to be able to play the piano by ear, but now I have to use my hands.
steps.content: I used to be able to play the piano by ear, but now I have to use my hands.

steps.title: What do you call an illegally parked frog?
steps.content: What do you call an illegally parked frog? Toad.
